overview_of_class: WWII transformed Asia, leading to defeat for Japan, Communist revolution in China, and the decolonization of the rest of Asia. The conflict wrought unprecedented destruction: entire cities were leveled, whole populations decimated. But civilians were not only victims; they were also participants in a "total war" for which governments mobilized societies and organized economies to a degree never before seen. This course will concentrate on the dilemmas that faced the war leaders and their followers, occupiers and the occupied alike.
name: World War II in Asia
subject: HISTORY
